data.Title: Google Search Console Removes How-to Enhancements Report
data.Description: Google has removed the How-to enhancement report from Google Search Console, following the discontinuation of how-to rich results in search results several months earlier.

data.Title: Google Search Console Removal Tool Drops Cache Updates
data.Description: Google Search Console's removal tool no longer provides cache updates, making it harder to confirm content removal. Users can still request snippet updates.

data.Title: Google Search Testing Shopping Filter Top Bar Interface
data.Description: Barry Schwartz shares a screenshot of Google testing a new top bar filter for shopping results, potentially changing how users refine product searches.

data.Title: Google Mobile Image Search Tests Pinch to Zoom
data.Description: Barry Schwartz reports on Google testing a pinch-to-zoom feature for mobile image search, potentially improving user experience for image viewing.

data.Title: Google Ads to Replace Old Design with New Design on August 30, 2024
data.Description: Barry Schwartz announces that Google Ads will retire its old design and transition to the new design, which has been in testing since 2023, starting August 30, 2024.

data.Title: Microsoft Advertising may automatically import your Google Ads conversion data
data.Description: Microsoft Advertising may automatically import your Google Ads conversion data if you have previously done Google Ads to Microsoft Ads imports.

data.Title: Google released Google Ads API version 17
data.Description: Google released Google Ads API version 17.

data.Title: Google Search Console Link Report Fixed After Reporting Increase in Links
data.Description: Google has confirmed a fix for the Search Console link report, which was reporting an increase in links for some sites. The issue was first reported by SEO professionals on Twitter.

data.Title: SEO Video Recap: Ranking Volatility, Coupon Site Abuse, Mobile Indexing & More
data.Description: Barry Schwartz shares his weekly SEO video recap, covering topics like Google Search ranking volatility, coupon sites engaging in site reputation abuse, mobile indexing changes, and AI Overview declines.

data.Title: Google will still index sites that are not mobile-friendly after July 5th
data.Description: Google will still index sites that are not mobile-friendly after July 5th - assuming you don't block Googlebot Smartphone.

data.Title: Google adds clarity to using white labeled coupon content on your site
data.Description: Google now explicitly says white-labeled coupon sites white-labeled can be against Google's site reputation abuse policy.

data.Title: Bing will create AI-generated Workspaces in Microsoft Edge for Windows 11
data.Description: Microsoft Edge will soon use AI to create a new Workspace with multiple tabs related to the users search query.

data.Title: Google Business Profile question and answers hidden bug
data.Description: Google Business Profile question and answers bug causes them to go hidden.

data.Title: Google Merchant Center analytics update
data.Description: Google Merchant Center testing new analytics UX.

data.Title: Apple to Integrate AI into Apps with New Opt-in Service Called Apple Intelligence
data.Description: Apple is planning to integrate AI capabilities into its apps through a new opt-in service called Apple Intelligence. The AI system will leverage large language models and include a revamped Siri experience.

data.Title: Google Algorithm Update Following Repo Leak Deemed Biggest Spike Ever Recorded
data.Description: SEO experts report that a recent Google algorithm update, potentially linked to a leaked repository, has caused the most significant ranking fluctuations ever observed.
